v1BrowserConfig.description:
BrowserConfig describes the current configuration for one Feature.
Instead of being simply enabled or disabled, features are enabled for a
particular percentage of clients (0% is entirely disabled, 100% is entirely enabled).
Clients are required to self-select a percentile value from 1 to 100 in a way that is random
and trusted to consider a Feature disabled if it is disabled for the selected percentile.
action_code_disabled describes what the Browser is expected to do if the Feature is not enabled for
their assigned percentile.
message_disabled may be displayed as a fallback action.
action_code_enabled describes what the Browser is expected to do if the Feature is enabled for
their assigned percentile. This enabled degraded modes. Can be empty.
message_enabled may be displayed while in degraded mode. Can be empty.
Likely additional fields will be added here as the Browser SDK behavior set becomes more complex.

v1GetBearerTokenResponse.description: GetBearerTokenResponse is a new Bearer Token.

feature.description: Information required to select and return the most recent BrowserContext version. If Feature names is nil, will return all Features in the organization associated with the bearer token/API key, otherwise only information related to the named Features will be returned.

v1GetBrowserContextRequest.description: The request from Browser SDKs for a Browser Context. SDKs are expected to periodically poll, giving the version of the most recent configuration seen. Configurations may be large; we will not re-send them unless they have changed.

v1GetBrowserContextResponse.description: The response to Browser SDKs is designed to be cacheable for short periods. It is also designed to be shareable between multiple clients (e.g. in case of SSR or use of CDN etc). May return 304 Not Modified with ETag header and empty payload.

versionSeen.description: Set if the client has seen a previous version of the config. Server will send data only if newer config available.

selector.description: Information required to select and return the correct GuardConfig version.

v1GetGuardConfigRequest.description: Request from Backend SDKs for a Guard Config. SDKs are expected to periodically poll, giving the version of the most recent configuration seen. Configurations may be large; we will not re-send them unless they have changed. Guard configurations may vary between environments but are SHARED between Services.

v1GetGuardConfigResponse.description: The response from Hub to Backend SDKs. Note that `config_data_sent` will be false and `config` will be empty if we did not have a newer config version than `version_seen`.

versionSeen.description: Set if the client has seen a previous version of the config. Server will send data only if newer config available.

service.title: Information required to select and return the most recent ServiceConfig version

v1GetServiceConfigRequest.description: The request from Backend SDKs for a Service Config. SDKs are expected to periodically poll, giving the version of the most recent configuration seen. Configurations may be large; we will not re-send them unless they have changed.

v1GetServiceConfigResponse.description: The response to Backend SDKs. Note that `config_data_sent` will be false and `config` will be empty if we did not have a newer config version than `version_seen`.

selector.description: Only tags which are used for quota management should be included here - i.e. the list of quota_tags returned by the GetGuardConfig endpoint for this Guard. If tags are in use only one quota token will be issued at a time.

clientId.description: Used for tracking per-client token usage, allowing automatic determination of efficient batch leases. ID should be assigned by Stanza clients and be unique per-customer. Host or instance names may be used, or a UUID.

priorityBoost.description: Used to boost priority - SDK can increase or decrease priority of request, relative to normal feature priority. For instance, a customer may wish to boost the priority of paid user traffic over free tier. Priority boosts may also be negative - for example, one might deprioritise bot traffic.

defaultWeight.description:
Used for request weighting, i.e. accounting for varying request sizes and costs. The value set here is the default request weight which should be assumed for leases. If not specified, then the median weight is used when granted leases. Actual weights should be set via the SetTokenLeaseConsumed rpc.

default_weight is optional; if not used then it is assumed that all requests have weight of 1.

v1GetTokenLeaseRequest.description: Requests token lease for given Guard at priority of specified feature.

v1GetTokenLeaseResponse.title: Specifies tokens granted and their duration (may be empty if none granted)

selector.description: Only tags which are used for quota management should be included here - i.e. the list of quota_tags returned by the GetGuardConfig endpoint for this Guard. If tags are in use only one quota token will be issued at a time.

clientId.description: Used for tracking per-client token usage, allowing automatic determination of efficient batch leases. ID should be assigned by Stanza clients and be unique per-customer. Host or instance names may be used, or a UUID.

priorityBoost.description: Used to increase or decrease priority of request, relative to normal feature priority.

weight.description:
Used for request weighting, i.e. accounting for varying request sizes and costs. If not specified then a default value of 1 is used. In cases where weights/costs are not known upfront, users can send an initial estimate as the weight, and then later, when the exact cost is known, send an updated weight via the SetTokenLeaseConsumed rpc.

weight is optional; if not used then it is assumed that all requests have weight of 1.

v1GetTokenRequest.description: Requests token for given Guard at priority of specified feature.

environment.description:
If specified, only stats relating to the tags and features in selector will be returned.
 If only guard and environment are specified, then stats relating to all tags and features will be returned.

guard.description: Query for stats for this specific guard. If not specified then stats for all guards are returned.

apikey.description: Query for stats where this specific APIKey was used. If not specified then stats for all APIKeys are returned.

feature.description: Query for stats about a specific feature. If not specified then stats for all features are returned.

priority.description: Query for stats about a specific priority level. If not specified then stats for all priorities are returned.

reportTags.description: Tags matching listed tag keys will be reported (individual timeseries returned for each value).

tags.description: Only stats relating to the specified tags will be returned.

reportAllTags.description: Report all tag values for all tags as separate timeseries. Overrides tags and report_tags params.

step.description: 1m to 1w - m is minutes; h hours; d days; w weeks (7d). Defaults to a step that results in <100 results. Minimum step 1m.

validateIngressTokens.description: Boolean representing wether to validate contents of the X-Stanza-Token header.

checkQuota.description: Boolean representing whether quota checks are enabled.
checkQuota.title: Quota

quotaTags.description: The set of tags which are used for quota management. For example, a 'customer_id' tag might be used to implement per-customer quota limits. Only the tags listed here should be included in GetToken and GetTokenLease requests.

v1GuardConfig.description:
GuardConfig represents a configuration for a given Stanza SDK instrumented Guard, which may be used by multiple services!
If check_quota is false, then no ratelimiting will be performed. All quota requests will succeed and the SDK may short-circuit quota requests, i.e. not call Hub for quota.
At a later point, there will be additional per-Guard configuration, such as deadline overrides, adaptive circuitbreaking configs, etc.

spanSelectors.title: If no selectors specified then config is applied to all requests

v1HeaderTraceConfig.description: Specifies which headers should be sampled - required by OTel spec.

collectorUrl.description: URL of OTEL metric collector. If URL begins with http or https it will be treated as an HTTP collector, otherwise it will be treated as a gRPC collector.

spanSelectors.title: If no selectors specified then config is applied to all requests

v1ParamTraceConfig.description: Specifies which request parameters should be sampled.

selector.description:
Only tags which are used for quota management should be included here - i.e. the list of quota_tags returned by the GetGuardConfig endpoint for this Guard. If tags are in use only one quota token will be issued at a time.

Required: GuardName, featureName, environment

priorityBoost.description: Used to boost priority - SDK can increase or decrease priority of request, relative to normal feature priority. For instance, a customer may wish to boost the priority of paid user traffic over free tier. Priority boosts may also be negative - for example, one might deprioritise bot traffic.

v1QueryGuardHealthRequest.description: Called by SDK to determine whether a Guard is overloaded at a given Feature's priority level. Used so that customer code can make good decisions about fail-fast or graceful degradation as high up the stack as possible. SDK may cache the result for up to 10 seconds.

v1QueryMode.description:
MODE_SUM: query results across various axes (features, tags, apikeys) are added up and one timeseries is returned.
MODE_REPORT: individual timeseries are returned for specified query axes.
If not specified then queries will default to MODE_SUM for all axes.

v1SentinelConfig.description: SentinelConfig represents Sentinel compliant JSON configuration for the given Sentinel types. These rules are "per service" (not per Guard) with Guard specific routing encoded in the given JSON blobs (as Sentinel "Resources").

v1ServiceConfig.description: ServiceConfig represents a configuration for a given Stanza SDK instrumented service.

weightCorrection.description: Used for request weighting, i.e. accounting for varying request sizes and costs. If weights are not known before request execution, then a default or estimated weight may be used, followed by a corrected value here. If a value is sent here, it should be the actual request weight.

v1SetTokenLeaseConsumedRequest.description: Notifies Hub that one or more token leases has been used, i.e. Guard has been exercised.

otelAttribute.title:
OTel attribute, e.g. peer.service, status, http.status_code. See:
https://opentelemetry.io/docs/reference/specification/trace/semantic_conventions/span-general/
https://opentelemetry.io/docs/reference/specification/trace/semantic_conventions/http/

value.description: Selector matches if value of 'otel_attribute' equals 'value'.

durationMsec.title: How long until lease expires, in milliseconds

expiresAt.title: If nil expiration should be calculated as time you received the lease + duration_msec

collectorUrl.description: URL of OTEL trace collector. If URL begins with http or https it will be treated as an HTTP collector, otherwise it will be treated as a gRPC collector.

v1TraceConfigOverride.description: This configuration allows different sample rates to be applied to selected spans.

feature.title: Axes for this timeseries - may not be applicable if there are no axes being queried in report mode

v1ValidateTokenRequest.description: Calls Hub to validate a token (ensures token has not expired, was minted by Hub, and related to the specified Guard). Used from Ingress Guards. Ensures callers have acquired quota prior to expending resources.

valid.title: Unused, does not work in batch mode, will remove in V1 API

v1ValidateTokenResponse.description: Specifies whether tokens were valid or not.
